taxonomicnotes: Horabagrus brachysoma was described by Albert Gunther (1864) from Cochin under the name Pseudobagrus brachysoma.
rationale: Horabagrus brachysoma is assessed as Vulnerable as populations have undergone declines over the last decade. While the population has declined by more than 50% in most (80%) of its range, recent conservation action in Vembanad and Shastankota lakes in Kerala has increased the populations there by 25%. Overall there has been a 35% decline in the global population due to overexploitation and habitat loss.
evaluator: Arunachalam, M., Madhusoodana Kurup, B., Basheer, V.S., Abraham, R. & Molur, S.
